<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/08/doordash-ipo-value-startup-36b?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Just Hear Those IPO Bells Ringing
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="DoorDash going public" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzU2L2Rvb3JkYXNoX2dvaW5nX3B1YmxpYy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week, DoorDash and Airbnb will go public in back-to-back mega IPOs, basically the sports equinox for Wall Street investors. Up tomorrow, the food delivery giant.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">DoorDash reportedly priced its shares at <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/08/doordash-sells-shares-at-102-in-ipo-pricing-above-range.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$102 a pop</a>, which, on a fully diluted basis, would equate to about a $39 billion market cap. The company had been aiming for $90–$95 a share just last week. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why the hype? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The pandemic solidified DoorDash's <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-doordash-pulled-ahead-in-food-delivery-war-11607438731?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lead in the U.S.</a> food delivery industry, catapulting its market share to nearly 50% (No. 2 Uber Eats has 28%). The success story begins in 2013...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As food delivery companies went wheel-to-wheel in cities, DoorDash opted for a market with less competition: the 'burbs. When the pandemic sent families scurrying out of urban areas, DoorDash was ready to greet them with $10 off a falafel family platter. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The suburbs offer some extra perks: Families tend to place larger orders ($$$), there's less traffic and more parking, and restaurants are generally farther away from homes, incentivizing customers to splurge on delivery.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, DoorDash says it has 58% of the suburban market. But as the top player in Dallas, Houston, Philly, D.C., Minneapolis, and SF, it's not exactly hurting in cities.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Are the numbers keeping up?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Monthly subscribers have more than tripled to 5 million, and 390,000+ merchants use its app. Q2 revenue jumped 214% annually, propelling DoorDash to the first profitable quarter for a food delivery company.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It lost some bragging rights after dipping back into a loss in Q3, but revenue still grew 268% annually and net losses fell over $380 million in the first nine months of the year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">DoorDash acknowledges that, like takeout french fries, its hot streak might not stand the test of time. One day, diners will venture back out. And with DoorDash commissions climbing <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/08/doordash-ipo-risk-restaurants-could-seek-cheaper-options.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">as high as 30%</a>, restaurants may look for cheaper options.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>DoorDash wants to move beyond food and offer last-mile delivery for other types of local businesses. Raising $3+ billion should help. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/08/uk-begins-inoculation-program-busy-day-vaccines?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Friends, Britons, Countrymen, Lend Me Your Arms
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Woman being greeted for getting a vaccine " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzU0L3dvbWFuX2JlaW5nX2dyZWV0ZWRfZm9yX2dldHRpbmdfYV92YWNjaW5lLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>JACOB KING/POOL/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's hard not to get a <em>little</em> emotional when looking at this picture of 90-year-old grandmother Margaret Keenan receiving a standing O from hospital staff in England yesterday morning. With a brief shot in the arm, Keenan <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-britain/go-for-it-says-grandmother-who-got-worlds-first-pfizer-covid-vaccine-in-britain-idUSKBN28I0OY?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">became the first person</a> outside of a clinical trial to receive Pfizer-BioNTech's coronavirus vaccine. The second person? A guy named <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-health-coronavirus-britain-shakespear/in-england-william-shakespeare-receives-a-covid-19-vaccine-idUKKBN28I109?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">William Shakespeare</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You might think the UK rolling out its mass inoculation program was enough vaccine news for one day, but there were several other important developments.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">More good news for Pfizer-BioNTech: </strong>Following deep analysis, the FDA <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/08/health/covid-vaccine-pfizer.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">concluded</a> that this vaccine reduced the risk of severe Covid-19 after just one dose (for full efficacy, it requires two doses three weeks apart). Tomorrow, an advisory panel of vaccine experts will decide whether to authorize it for emergency use. Fingers crossed.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">AstraZeneca and Oxford get a stamp of approval: </strong>A new, peer-reviewed study <a href="https://apnews.com/article/international-news-pandemics-australia-coronavirus-pandemic-united-nations-general-assembly-ffa6578ee348994909e6cdf502a19831?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">showed</a> the pair's Covid-19 vaccine, whose confusing initial results raised questions in the medical community, is about 70% effective at preventing infection.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>President-elect and fan of symmetry Joe Biden <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-08/biden-vows-100-million-does-of-vaccine-within-his-first-100-days?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">promised</a> 100 million vaccines in the first 100 days of his administration. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CYBERSECURITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/08/cybersecurity-giant-fireeye-suffers-massive-attack?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Who Can Protect the Protectors?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Federal Bureau of Investigations, apparently. Yesterday, cybersecurity company FireEye <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-fireeye-cyber/u-s-cybersecurity-firm-fireeye-discloses-breach-theft-of-internal-hacking-tools-idUSKBN28I31E?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> it had been hacked by a nation-state—and called the FBI. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The company said the attacker accessed some of its internal systems and zeroed in on information about government clients. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What FireEye is: </strong>the go-to security provider for governments and companies that suffer sophisticated hacks; for instance, it helped Sony and Equifax bulletproof their operations following breaches. So this is like if an animal control office got infested by raccoons. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>FireEye's tools work by imitating actual hacking tools, making them an attractive target for a window-shopping hacker. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The FBI referred the case to its Russia specialists, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/08/technology/fireeye-hacked-russians.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">indicating</a> which nation-state the evidence points to. It's possible that Russian hackers took advantage of American attention on election infrastructure to target FireEye. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> We don't know yet if client data was exposed, but the investigation only just started. </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/08/hbo-max-strong-user-growth-fallout-upending-theatrical-window-continues?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

You Come at the King, You'd Best Not Miss
</font></a>
</h1>

<!--[if mso]>

<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The execs in charge of HBO Max should know that better than anyone. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last week, Warner Bros. sent tremors from Echo Park to Santa Monica when it <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/03/warner-bros-release-2021-films-theaters-hbo-max?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decided</a> to release its 2021 films directly to HBO Max the same day they're released in theaters, bucking the time-honored custom of a "theatrical window." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The straight-to-streaming decision has upset Hollywood creators. In a fiery statement Monday night, filmmaker Christopher Nolan said, "They don't even understand what they're losing. Their decision makes no economic sense." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But new data shows that Warner Bros. parent AT&T may be right to focus on streaming. HBO Max <a href="https://blog.apptopia.com/hbo-max-is-now-the-fastest-growing-major-svod-service-in-the-us?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is now</a> the fastest-growing major streaming video-on-demand service in the U.S., per Apptopia. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Then again, it's still playing catch-up. According to AT&T CEO John Stankey, HBO Max will notch 12.6 million activated accounts by today. That's a nice bounce from 8.6 million on Sept. 30...but miles behind Disney+'s 73.7 million subscribers. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Showbiz folks aren't known for their understanding. The Hollywood Reporter <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/christopher-nolan-rips-hbo-max-as-worst-streaming-service-denounces-warner-bros-plan?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a> that AT&T could be headed for a mountain of legal scuffles. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/08/apple-unveils-airpods-max-first-overear-headphones?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Beats by Cook
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="AirPods Max" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzU1L2FpcnBvZHNfbWF4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Apple</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you're looking for a new way to flex on your Zoom calls, Apple unveiled its <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/12/8/21438042/apple-max-studio-noise-canceling-headphones-price-date?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first over-ear headphones</a> yesterday, the AirPods Max.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It'd be quite the flex. At $549, the AirPods Max cost hundreds of dollars more than similar headphones from Bose and Sony. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But they're completely on-brand for Apple, which offers premium products at ultra-premium prices. These headphones are noise-canceling, have up to 20 hours of battery life, and come with various whiz-bang features like automatically pausing audio when you take them off your ears.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>We all made fun of the design of Apple's in-ear AirPods when they debuted in 2016, but the "don't talk to me because I could potentially be listening to a podcast" look caught on. Apple's wearables revenue (<a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-to-sell-airpods-max-over-the-ear-headphones-for-549-11607438805?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up 21%</a> last fiscal year) has been a surprise growth segment for the company as iPhone sales plateau. And the AirPods Max is a play to capitalize on that success. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the headphones <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-08/apple-launches-airpods-max-headphones-into-crowded-market?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">arrive</a> Dec. 15, and Apple's workout service, Fitness+ ($9.99/mo.), will debut Dec. 14. </p>

style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esupports a relief bill\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e without liability protections for businesses but \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ealso \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ewithout state and local government aid. That's both a concession and a challenge to Democrats, who've insisted on helping out local governments but also oppose legal immunity.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThey responded well to ^. style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nJust Hear Those IPO Bells Ringing\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"DoorDash going public\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzU2L2Rvb3JkYXNoX2dvaW5nX3B1YmxpYy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis week, DoorDash and Airbnb will go public in back-to-back mega IPOs, basically the sports equinox for Wall Street investors. Up tomorrow, the food delivery giant.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDoorDash reportedly priced its shares at \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/08/doordash-sells-shares-at-102-in-ipo-pricing-above-range.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$102 a pop\u003c/a\u003e, which, on a fully diluted basis, would equate to about a $39 billion market cap. The company had been aiming for $90–$95 a share just last week. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy the hype? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe pandemic solidified DoorDash's \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-doordash-pulled-ahead-in-food-delivery-war-11607438731?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elead in the U.S.\u003c/a\u003e food delivery industry, catapulting its market share to nearly 50% (No. 2 Uber Eats has 28%). The success story begins in 2013...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs food delivery companies went wheel-to-wheel in cities, DoorDash opted for a market with less competition: the 'burbs. When the pandemic sent families scurrying out of urban areas, DoorDash was ready to greet them with $10 off a falafel family platter. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe suburbs offer some extra perks: Families tend to place larger orders ($$$), there's less traffic and more parking, and restaurants are generally farther away from homes, incentivizing customers to splurge on delivery.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, DoorDash says it has 58% of the suburban market. But as the top player in Dallas, Houston, Philly, D.C., Minneapolis, and SF, it's not exactly hurting in cities.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAre the numbers keeping up?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMonthly subscribers have more than tripled to 5 million, and 390,000+ merchants use its app. Q2 revenue jumped 214% annually, propelling DoorDash to the first profitable quarter for a food delivery company.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt lost some bragging rights after dipping back into a loss in Q3, but revenue still grew 268% annually and net losses fell over $380 million in the first nine months of the year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDoorDash acknowledges that, like takeout french fries, its hot streak might not stand the test of time. One day, diners will venture back out. And with DoorDash commissions climbing \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/08/doordash-ipo-risk-restaurants-could-seek-cheaper-options.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eas high as 30%\u003c/a\u003e, restaurants may look for cheaper options.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eDoorDash wants to move beyond food and offer last-mile delivery for other types of local businesses. Raising $3+ billion should help. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt's hard not to get a With a brief shot in the arm, Keenan \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-britain/go-for-it-says-grandmother-who-got-worlds-first-pfizer-covid-vaccine-in-britain-idUSKBN28I0OY?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebecame the first person\u003c/a\u003e outside of a clinical trial to receive Pfizer-BioNTech's coronavirus vaccine. The second person? A guy named \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-health-coronavirus-britain-shakespear/in-england-william-shakespeare-receives-a-covid-19-vaccine-idUKKBN28I109?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWilliam Shakespeare\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou might think the UK rolling out its mass inoculation program was enough vaccine news for one day, but there were several other important developments.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMore good news for Pfizer-BioNTech: \u003c/strong\u003eFollowing deep analysis, the FDA \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/08/health/covid-vaccine-pfizer.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econcluded\u003c/a\u003e that this vaccine reduced the risk of severe Covid-19 after just one dose (for full efficacy, it requires two doses three weeks apart). Tomorrow, an advisory panel of vaccine experts will decide whether to authorize it for emergency use. Fingers crossed.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAstraZeneca and Oxford get a stamp of approval: target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshowed\u003c/a\u003e the pair's Covid-19 vaccine, whose confusing Protectors?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Federal Bureau of Investigations, apparently. Yesterday, cybersecurity company FireEye \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-fireeye-cyber/u-s-cybersecurity-firm-fireeye-discloses-breach-theft-of-internal-hacking-tools-idUSKBN28I31E?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e it had been hacked by a nation-state—and called the FBI. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe company said the attacker accessed some of its internal systems and zeroed in on information about government clients. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat FireEye is: \u003c/strong\u003ethe go-to security provider for governments and companies that suffer sophisticated hacks; for instance, it helped Sony and Equifax bulletproof their operations following breaches. So this is like if an animal control office got infested by raccoons. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFireEye's tools work by imitating actual hacking tools, making them an attractive target for a window-shopping hacker. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe FBI referred the case to its Russia specialists, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/08/technology/fireeye-hacked-russians.html?action=click\u0026module=Top%20Stories\u0026pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eindicating\u003c/a\u003e which nation-state the evidence points to. It's possible that Russian hackers took advantage of American attention on election infrastructure to target FireEye. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e We don't know yet if client data was exposed, but the style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe execs in charge of HBO Max should know that better than anyone. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast week, Warner Bros. sent tremors from Echo Park to Santa Monica when it \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/03/warner-bros-release-2021-films-theaters-hbo-max?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edecided\u003c/a\u003e to release its 2021 films directly to HBO Max the same day they're released in theaters, bucking the time-honored custom of a \"theatrical window.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe straight-to-streaming decision has upset Hollywood creators. In a fiery statement Monday night, filmmaker Christopher Nolan said, \"They don't even understand what they're losing. Their decision makes no economic sense.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut new data shows that Warner Bros. parent AT\u0026T may be right to focus on streaming. HBO Max \u003ca href=\"https://blog.apptopia.com/hbo-max-is-now-the-fastest-growing-major-svod-service-in-the-us?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis now\u003c/a\u003e the fastest-growing major streaming video-on-demand service in the U.S., per Apptopia. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThen again, it's still playing catch-up. According to AT\u0026T CEO John Stankey, HBO Max will notch 12.6 million activated accounts by today. That's a nice bounce from 8.6 million on Sept. 30...but miles behind Disney+'s 73.7 million subscribers. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eShowbiz folks aren't known for their understanding. At $549, the AirPods Max cost hundreds of dollars more than similar headphones from Bose and Sony. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut they're completely on-brand for Apple, which offers premium products at ultra-premium prices. These headphones are noise-canceling, have up to 20 hours of battery life, and come with various whiz-bang features like automatically pausing audio when you take them off your ears.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWe all made fun of the design of Apple's in-ear AirPods when they debuted in 2016, but the \"don't talk to me because I could potentially be listening to a podcast\" look caught on. Apple's wearables revenue (\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-to-sell-airpods-max-over-the-ear-headphones-for-549-11607438805?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eup 21%\u003c/a\u003e last fiscal year) has been a surprise growth segment for the company as iPhone sales plateau. And the AirPods Max is a play to capitalize on that success. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe headphones \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-08/apple-launches-airpods-max-headphones-into-crowded-market?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earrive\u003c/a\u003e Dec. 15, and Apple's workout service, Fitness+ ($9.99/mo.), will debut Dec. 14. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F12%2F08%2Fapple-unveils-airpods-max-first-overear-headphones\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
